message:
From the other side, the pro-Hamas students at UCLA call out to the Los Angeles police officers:

Pigs go home!

##
The whole story is in two videos.

California, UCLA:

Los Angeles police officers arrive at the university grounds and are greeted with sympathetic chants from the pro-Israel students:

USA, USA, USA !

message:
An important statement yesterday by the spokesperson of the American State Department, regarding the lawsuits against Israel for the war in Gaza:

We believe that the International Criminal Court in The Hague has no jurisdiction in this matter.
event_breakdown: - Statement by the spokesperson of the American State Department regarding lawsuits against Israel for the war in Gaza

message:
Hezbollah announces a death in its ranks:

Vahid Tefili, born in 2000 from the village of Deir al-Zahrani in southern Lebanon.

Vahid was seriously injured more than four days ago and died tonight from his wounds. The circumstances of his death are not specified.
In addition to being a Hezbollah military operative, he was a "commander" in the local Hezbollah scout tribe.

Number 291
event_breakdown:
- Hezbollah announces the death of Vahid Tefili, a military operative and "commander" in the local Hezbollah scout tribe.
- Vahid Tefili was born in 2000 in the village of Deir al-Zahrani in southern Lebanon.
- Vahid was seriously injured over four days ago and succumbed to his wounds. The exact circumstances surrounding his death remain unspecified.

message:
The operation in Rafah - the Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper (Hezbollah-affiliated) from its sources:

The US demands that Israel evacuate at least 800,000 displaced people from Rafah before the attack in the area. 40,000 tents arrived in Israel from China, paid for by the United Arab Emirates. Each tent can accommodate 20 people (a total of 800,000 people).

There is a concentration of about a thousand IDF vehicles, including tanks and APCs in the southern area of ​​the Gaza Strip (on the Israeli side).
Israel is planning to break into Rafah from the area of ​​the Sofa crossing and the Kerem Shalom crossing.

The Egyptians asked to check with the leadership of Hamas, whether its military arm is planning to blow up the fences in the border area with Egypt in order to cause crowds to flee to Egyptian territory.
event_breakdown:
1. The US demands Israel to evacuate 800,000 displaced people from Rafah before an attack.
2. 40,000 tents arrived in Israel from China, paid for by the United Arab Emirates, each tent can accommodate 20 people.
3. Concentration of about a thousand IDF vehicles, including tanks and APCs in the southern area of the Gaza Strip.
4. Israel plans to break into Rafah from the Sofa crossing and Kerem Shalom crossing.
5. Egyptians request confirmation from Hamas leadership if its military arm plans to blow up fences at the border with Egypt.

message:
City University of New York (CUNY): NYPD remove the Palestinian flag and return the American flag to its rightful place.

How symbolic.
event_breakdown: - City University of New York (CUNY): NYPD remove the Palestinian flag and return the American flag to its rightful place.

message:
University of Washington: Olivia Feldman, a Jewish student, says that she does not feel safe on her university's campus and notes that she was shouted at to "go back to the gas chambers."

Olivia is the great-granddaughter of a Holocaust survivor.

#Antisemitism_on_campuses

message: NYPD buses with the detainees from tonight leave the grounds of Columbia University.

message:
US media channels reports that the NYPD arrested about a hundred people on Columbia University's campus.

In a statement, Columbia University claimed that the leaders of the protest on campus are not even students of the university, but rather external parties.

The president of the university asked the police forces to remain on the university campus until May 17th to maintain order and make sure that no tent camps are set up on campus.
event_breakdown:
- NYPD arrests around 100 people on Columbia University's campus.
- Columbia University claims protest leaders are external parties, not students.
- University president requests police presence until May 17th to prevent tent camps.

message:
Tomorrow will be a month since the last attack attributed to Israel in Damascus, the capital of Syria - the attack in which Muhammad Reza Zahedi, the commander of the Quds Force in the Iranian Revolutionary Guards in the Syrian and Lebanese sector, was killed.

According to Syrian sources, this is the longest quiet period in the skies of Damascus in recent years.

Is the Iranian deterrence working?
event_breakdown:
- Attack attributed to Israel in Damascus, Syria
- Killing of Muhammad Reza Zahedi, commander of the Quds Force in the Iranian Revolutionary Guards
- Longest quiet period in the skies of Damascus in recent years

message:
A young Jewish man does not allow Al Jazeera's reporter, Najwan Simri, to broadcast a report (which is not sympathetic to Israel, to put it mildly) regarding the stabbing attack by the Turkish citizen today in the Old City of Jerusalem.
He repeats to the camera: don't listen to their nonsense.
She later turns to the Israeli police stationed in the area, complaining about the young man and falsely claiming he is touching her.
It is worth noting they are members of the same force (Israeli Border Police) that was attacked.
event_breakdown:
- Al Jazeera's reporter, Najwan Simri, attempts to broadcast a report on a stabbing attack by a Turkish citizen in the Old City of Jerusalem
- A young Jewish man intervenes and prevents the broadcast, urging viewers not to listen to the report
- Najwan Simri complains to Israeli police about the young man, falsely claiming he touched her
- Both the young man and Najwan Simri are members of the Israeli Border Police force

message:
The Israel Police publishes CCTV footage of today's stabbing attack near the Flowers Gate in the Old City of Jerusalem.

The Turkish terrorist stalked the two police officers from behind, and then pulled out a knife and started stabbing one of two.

Thankfully the officers managed to fight him off, sustaining only minor injuries.

As previously mentioned, the terrorist was shot and killed.
location: Flowers Gate in the Old City of Jerusalem
event_breakdown:
- Israel Police release CCTV footage of stabbing attack near Flowers Gate in Old City of Jerusalem.
- Turkish terrorist stabs police officers from behind, prompting officers to fight back.
- Officers sustain minor injuries while subduing the attacker.
- Attacker shot and killed by authorities.

message:
An investigation by the Times sheds light on Ebrahim Al-Arjani's "Ya Hala" company, and on the profit it made on the backs of Gazans attempting to flee the violence in the Strip.

According to the report, Al-Arjani company generated $88 million by "coordinating" the departure of 20,000 Gazans from the Gaza Strip during the month March alone (This "service" has been available for at least 5-6 months.)

According to estimates, around 85,000 individuals have left Gaza since the onset of the conflict, paying approximately $5,000 per person.

Ebrahim Al-Arjani holds significant influence in North Sinai. He is a member of the Tarabin tribe and owns the Ibna Sina'a company, which imports and exports goods from Gaza. Al-Arjani holds close ties with Egyptian President Al-Sisi, he played a pivotal role in organizing the Bedouins of North Sinai into a paramilitary force, aiding the Egyptian army against groups like ISIS, and is known to be a business partner of the Egyptian President's son.
event_breakdown:
- Investigation by the Times sheds light on Ebrahim Al-Arjani's "Ya Hala" company profiting from Gazans fleeing violence in the Gaza Strip.
- Al-Arjani company generated $88 million by coordinating the departure of 20,000 Gazans in March alone, with this service available for at least 5-6 months.
- Around 85,000 individuals have left Gaza since the conflict began, paying around $5,000 per person.
- Ebrahim Al-Arjani holds influence in North Sinai, being a member of the Tarabin tribe and owning Ibna Sina'a company that trades goods from Gaza.
- Al-Arjani has close ties with Egyptian President Al-Sisi, played a role in organizing Bedouins of North Sinai into a paramilitary force, aiding the Egyptian army against groups like ISIS, and is a business partner of the President's son.

message:
The Lebanese government's crisis management team publishes data on the war with Israel.

Since October 7, 4010 air and ground attacks have been carried out on targets in Lebanon.

The 5 villages that were attacked the most are:
Ayta ash Shab - 339 times
Hula - 311 times
Naqoura - 256 times
Aalma ech Chaab - 241 times
Tayr Harfa - 215 times.

The team also reported that since October 7th, 438 people have been killed in Lebanese territory, of which 337 are militants (Hezbollah and other organizations), 100 civilians and one Lebanese soldier.
event_breakdown:
- The Lebanese government's crisis management team publishes data on the war with Israel.
- Since October 7, 4010 air and ground attacks have been carried out on targets in Lebanon.
- The 5 villages that were attacked the most are: Ayta ash Shab - 339 times, Hula - 311 times, Naqoura - 256 times, Aalma ech Chaab - 241 times, Tayr Harfa - 215 times.
- The team also reported that since October 7th, 438 people have been killed in Lebanese territory, of which 337 are militants (Hezbollah and other organizations), 100 civilians, and one Lebanese soldier.
